references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for graph neural networks (GNNs), providing a seminal architecture used extensively in the field and by the current paper.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper introduced a key technique for inductive learning on graphs, allowing GNNs to generalize to unseen graph structures, an important aspect of the current work.

references.paper_title: GCC: Graph contrastive coding for graph neural network pre-training
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on pre-training GNNs which forms the basis for the current paper's approach to leverage pre-trained models.

references.paper_title: GPT-GNN: Generative pre-training of graph neural networks
references.reason: This work explored generative pre-training for GNNs, offering a different perspective on model training that is related to the current paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Prodigy: An expeditiously adaptive parameter-free learner
references.reason: This paper introduced a parameter-free in-context learning method, offering a comparison and contrast to the proposed retrieval-augmented approach in the current paper.
